txt.en: Akûshu has requested you slay some of the usan-kûni scorpions to the south at a place called Nirikal, and scather-flies in the bog near the river-bank at Umûn Khab.
You have slain many of the usan-kûni and scather-flies that posed a threat to the horses' safety. You should talk to Akûshu at Gha Nêkha, south of Eshadûr in Ambarûl.
Defeat scather-flies at at Umûn Khab ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Would you slay some of the usan-kûni to the south and the scather-flies in the marsh on the river-bank?'
'[placeholder], thank you so much for dealing with those horrid beasts. Do the horses seem more calm to you? I think I am more calm, anyway!'
Akûshu worries about the scorpions and marsh-flies being a threat to the horses.

'Thank you friend for stopping to help us. Though we have some shelter here, I am worried for the horses. Many beasts in Shâgana would happily make a meal of them. If you are able, would you slay some of wild beasts? I am particularly concerned about the usan-kûni to the south at a place called Nirikal and the scather-flies in the marsh along the river-bank at Umûn Khab.'
